bio: All designs created and doodled with icing by (& copyright) me. I don't use molds, stencils, or impression mats. I live in Chicago!

posts.description: Life is rough. Have a cookie. Happy Thanksgiving!
Whoa, snakes. Don't bother the snakes. Leave alllllllll the snakes alone.
Purple and green.
tray of needlework cookies, ready to be packaged and sent out
Beginning a week of cookies in St. Patrick's Day colors — green & gold, white & green...
Little Chicago Christmas flag cookies for the @hideoutchicago holiday sale this Wednesday
Jade-y greens with open scrollwork of two kinds in the middle.
A little red and yellow carousel of a cookie. Happy Friday! (Remember: cookies are for eating.)
Little coin-size-sized cookies — each design different
Tiny chocolate peppermint cookies for the @hideoutchicago holiday sale tomorrow.

Posting this mostly for fellow cookiers as an example of a nutty experiment! It has both bridgeless (upper left photo) and bridge stringwork, all kinda sloppy as I played with making the structure work. (Can also see the cracks in the lower right stringwork in that top photo; sections had to be knocked out/redone many times.) 3" diameter cookie. I'm just not sure gravity will let me do all I am imagining. In the meantime I persevere!
Green
A cookie for a pal.
A sculpture gallery of @illustratedcookies 3-D cookies! with a dime for scale
Simple ziggurat design that really pleases me (chocolate cookie, chocolate glaze, mint icing overlay)
I forgot to post this picture on Instagram for
Abraham Lincoln's reading glasses in a Della Robbia frame. Happy Presidents' Day!

A tray of (garden) green cookies of different shades for Veggie Bingo. See you tonight at @hideoutchicago!
https://www.facebook.com/events/1772124103070283/

Happy 5th Day of Christmas! And hello to new followers. Here are final photos of miniature gingerbread houses I made last week — (extensive) technical details are in the comments on my FB photo, link below. Hope everyone's having a good week, with — esp for cookie-makers, who hustle hard at Christmas — a bit of a break in there.
Bridge-like stringwork crosses a donut-shaped cookie covered in green royal icing
Simple (1") sweet vegetable cookies for the last Veggie Bingo at @hideoutchicago tonight! @smmsachs
Happy Friday—
a little chocolate mint mat (it kind of reminds me of a Mountain Weave napkin)
Orb. Orrrrb. An orb. An experiment in reverse half-tone done with—icing.
Teeeeeeeeeny-tiny "stitches" on a muslin handkerchief cookie (spoon for scale!). With a rose-red monogram.
Some birthday cookie Ms. And Ms. M&Ms.

This is the result of an experiment in monochromatic design....didn't end up where I was trying to go (I'll try that one again later) but thought I'd post this in the meantime since it was kind if interesting. O experiments!
some cooky ridiculousness for your Tuesday

Happy chocolate mint Friday! I've been on a brief cookying break due to (you may not laugh) a decorating injury. Too-thick icing, tiny nozzle, not knowing when to stop...you do the math. Regardless, have a good weekend, a good Easter if that's your holiday, see you soon with more cookies.

Happy Monday, have a cookie! The more 3-D decoration on this new one (see side-view, below) evidences my increasing interest in English/German overpiping, sometimes called Lambeth piping, which is more properly done on cakes. The delay in posting the photos evidences the fact that I've actually hurt both my hands, more relevantly my piping hand, in recent weeks, but am slowly getting back to work. Everyone says it, but it's true: quite possible to overdo the piping. Heh!
A silly SaulBassian cookie group with a twirly bit atop. Happy Friday.
geometric/somehow upholstery-like design on a (pouffe-like) cookie with garden of icing twirlies growing on top

(more) Letter As! I think I said this in the Epicurious article, but calligraphy or even just drawn letters with icing like this are like learning to dance backwards in heels. Very interesting (n tricky)! Happy Friday.
Tidying out the cookie library.

I'm deep into stand mixer research at the moment — bakers of all kinds: any feelings about which ones / which size you like the most? (pro? artisan? classic? artisan mini? other brands?) Feel free to respond if you'd like, thanks!
I got this idea from @thebakedequation's IG feed: a baby bottle dryer for drying all the (often tiny) hand-washed bits and bobs of cookie-decorating!
Stringwork (called "oriental stringwork") on a donut-shaped chocolate mint cookie ‪
25 little tiles make one big (chocolate) azulejo
Purple and berry pedestal (four different views). See also the Facebook posting for an additional mid-construction photo.
Happy Friday!
Pile of needlework cookies, sealed & ready to go
Illuminated initials for a rare books librarian. Happy weekend!
Green and red, green and red! Nowt to do with Christmas, just fall colors and some gilding. Happy Friday.

Happy spring Monday! Herz, mein Herz, sei nicht beklommen... For fellow cookiers: I've been playing with using an engraving drill on cookies for a while now. I like to use it for drilling holes through them, or pilot holes in which to countersink structural items made from dry gumpaste or royal icing transfers. However, it is tricky for engraved lettering -- hard royal icing tends to shatter; the carbide drill bit is much harder than sugar/crystalline structure of the icing! -- but I'm starting to sort of make it work. Note: I can’t speak to the edibleness of engraved cookies. Fun to play with as a calligrapher. Background needlework by Kim Britt.
a ridiculous candy-cookie carousel (Pez, mini-M&Ms, Necco wafer) in purple-pink-yellow-green
St. Pat! Throwing out da snakes.
Cookie set for a friend (two chocolate/mint, two sugar). 'Appy weekend!
Happy Easter weekend, to those who partake!
Coooookie! Happy Friday! Cookie-Day!

Last week without realizing it I passed 500 subscribers on Instagram, which is so nice, and I thought I'd make cookie to thank you all. Have a lovely First of May, may there be many posies on your door.
Needlework on teal (on chocolate)! Cookie is about 3" across, grid is pretty tiny.
An excessive little purple cookie epergne. Happy Friday, Happy Passover, ‪
Happy Monday, happy MLK Day. Hope you have a good day. Have a cookie.
Shiny geometric cookie. Happy weekend!
Set of cookie "handkerchiefs" for a woman named Rose (for a client).

Feeling lucky and gratified to be featured in this article from @epicurious about cookie videos (and cookiers) and their appeal - also features thoughts from @juliamusher and images by @mezesmanna @thecookiearchitect @sweet_prodigy @sweetambs and @my_little_bakery2016

Lace overlay on opaque chocolate glaze - never seen it before, but I like how it turned out (playing with lots of combos; the chocolate changes the color of the royal icing overlay a bit, but In cool ways)
A midcentury cookie tableau: patterned throw rug, (chocolate) coffee table, bowl & fruit. What more could a tiny person want? ‪

From this weekend's cookie doodles. I've started using cake stringwork on (flat) cookies by tilting them on a little platform—I'm really enjoying what it can let you do. Makes my calligraphic self very happy!
Square tea cookies last weekend
Lace cookie! Hope you had a good
Little poker-chip cookie with pencil for scale. Happy Friday!
My first post on Instagram! Chocolate cookie and royal icing "lace handkerchiefs." More of my work, old and new, to come at this account!
Yellow sparkly donut cookie star Tuesday. That's a thing, right?
Simple cooky for afternoon tea!
Florentine endpaper (cookies)
A ridiculous cookie for a regular ol December Tuesday.
Dozens of colors of leftover icings poured into the same bin (to make a base for black). Bonus: kinda looks like a melting clown mask in the middle.
Ring-shaped marbled cookies with little royal icing hot air balloons?—tiny aviaries?—cricket cages?—anchored at the center, tiny finials on their tops. Happy weekend, keep fighting.
Tiny sugar rosebuds to melt on your tongue, on periwinkle, sky blue, celadon & leaf green cookies
Tiny gingerbread house surgery. See y'all tomorrow at @hideoutchicago Holiday Sale! (assuming these survive)
Voulez-vous une Pez? (un Pez?)
Bit of a nod to Arts & Crafts/Sullivan seed shapes
Tile! Cookie. Cookie-tiles.
Needlepoint clover-like green leaves on dark background.

Antique cigar band cookies! Designs I made up. Took a few minor liberties with antique bands' distinctive look—very minor, but of necessity; it's hard to easily recreate their distinctively tiny, simple/square-ish type (cookies are all about 6" long! I was using an 5/0 paintbrush) that I think contrasts so interestingly with their ornate qualities. But still fun to play around.
Valentdoodles, all kinds of reds
Twirly cookie tower. Tower layers on the right. Top 3-D widget is royal icing with gum paste "seam." Spacers are Pep-O-Mint Life Savers, central support is a lollipop stick. Happy Friday!
nod to Chicago School architectural decoration (gonna tile a whole building with cookies someday – something like that).
A totally (totally) authentic Greek temple with Pez caryatids, Necco altar, mini M&M column capitals, icing acroterion and fence.
Allée of (icing) cypress trees & a tiny (icing) roadster
Also selling tonight: simple, graphic, fragrant gingerbread ornaments (not for eating)! Heavy gingerbread pomanders. @hideoutchicago
Green and gold.

Two-level green cookie, with stringwork on both layers -- three concentric circles of stringwork on the top, donut-shaped cookie -- and on the gumpaste flag. (Practical! Good for school lunch boxes!) Different shades of green, with pearl luster on parts. Fellow pastry and sugar art nerds: the circles of stringwork were realllllly tricky but also a fun challenge; want to keep experimenting / building better rigging to try.

Serene, severe little garden. An experiment in sharp-edged "poured concrete" royal icing shapes, a la the Lubetkin Penguin Pool, molded with acetate sheets and microplaning. This is Day 4 of New Cookie(s) Every Day this week -- last new batch tomorrow! Back to a more regular schedule next week.

Happy Friday! A collection of (chocolate mint) cookies from this week — stringwork, needlework, a sort of Arts & Crafts one, other techniques. (Five of those were posted earlier this week, the rest are new.) Have a good weekend!
A shoreline: ground, sun, water. In cookies. (more abstracted work than usual)
Green bas-relief cookie-tile.
Cookie, decorated cookie—
Another lace handkerchief (chocolate cookie/royal icing)!
Continuing to play with new techniques for making 'lace handkerchiefs'; really like how this one (with monogram) turned out! Expect more of these—of everything; I use my accounts to show
Monday. What is this "Monday"? Silly small blue & white & gold domed pagoda openwork cookie-thing
Some chocolate mint cookies for your Friday delectation
Cookies! To go with that coffee in your
textures
a cookie box — glittery insides, stained glass top and bottom (blue and green), different colors on each side (red/yellow, yellow/green, green/blue, blue/red)
My contribution to

This coming Tuesday, December 20, at 6:00 pm, I will be selling cookie-type items, such as these fragrant (but not very edible) gingerbread ornaments, along with other (actually edible) things if they all turn out, at the annual Hideout Holiday Sale! Come on out! Many fabulous vendors there. https://www.facebook.com/events/181592802291066/ Headsup: my cookies are expensive! (At least I think they are.) They are one-off, special occasion cookies that I draw/doodle one at a time and usually take around an hour each so are priced accordingly! (Until such time as I can or want to mass produce them a bit more, at least.) I dont want anyone too be too disappointed by this, so I'm noting that here. :) See you there, I hope!
Previous with another mint chocolate cookie
"petals" opening on a dark green/metallic green cookie

Tomorrow night is the final Veggie Bingo of the season at @hideoutchicago! There will be a lot of great bingo prizes as usual, and I will bring cookies for my contribution (two sets, I believe). Do come out! More info here: https://www.facebook.com/events/1772124103070283/
I thought it was time to include my cat on a cookie (also some [tweaked] Christopher Smart). A bit twee, but — happy weekend! :)
A kooky little cooky epergne (with mini M&Ms), too delicate to last in this world. For indeed royal icing is an amazing but moody thing. Lower right photo: remember—‪
Tiny little @illustratedcookies pig says hey. Happy Wednesday. 🐖
Chocolate mint Monday.
Cookie?
A Mother's Day cookie set, with detail (above), all for a nice mom named (obviously) Jean! Have a good weekend, humans. ‪
Tea and cookies!

Miscellaneous cookie equipment and methodology roundup! If you're interested. 1. Drying paintbrushes by rubber-banding them to a canister, to hang upside down and in the air so no water pools within the ferrules and loosens the brush glue. 2. Cookie supplies-washing tableau: cutters, microplane, clamps, candy thermometer, tiny spoons & melamine bowls, tips, couplers, palette trays. 3. Leftover dyed isomalt poured into the well of a silicone baking tin to form an ingot for storage (in a plastic container with food-safe silica gel packet). 4 Refilling the Everclear bottle using a funnel. I decant it into a dark bottle that I bought at Chef Rubber (it has an eyedropper--far and away the easiest/least wasteful way I've found to dispense small amounts of alcohol). 5. Great tool: dishwasher safe melamine soy sauce dishes, which I use for mixing small amounts of decorative icing, metallic glazes. 6. Mixing leftover royal icings to make a ([n] eventually) muddy grey / brown easy base for black icing. 6. Rainbow of icings for a project. I mostly use tipless disposable icing bags these days; for clamps I use purple Wilton bag ties and small IKEA clamps. 7. Weirdly essential tool for mixing icing: OXO jar spatula. I color my icings in a small plastic container using this tool, which allows great control for mixing, getting in corners, and scraping down the smallest bits of icing. So far it has resisted staining from gel paste colors. 9. Rows of royal icing transfers doodled on wax paper. 10. Royal icing transfers application tableau with scribe tools, tweezers, and transfers (I store mine in screw-top Darice bead containers). I was using the small strainer to shake through tiny bits of gold paint that were coming off the gilded transfers.
Next month — Dec 20 — I'll be at the annual @hideoutchicago Holiday Sale. In the meantime: Happy Monday Winter Cookies to you!
Cookie! Happy Thursday.
A rebus for 2018. Come on out to the last Soup & Bread of the season, the annual Soup & Bread & Pie (& Other Roundish Desserts). 5:30 – 8:00 pm at @hideoutchicago.
More than 500 likes for the Illustrated Cookies Facebook page — thank you so much!

All kinds of crunchy little snowflake cookies. All kinds of snowflakes! (Note the Chicago snowflake in the middle.) These cookies are crunchy, not soft, but regardless, if they get too hard as cookies are wont to do in the winter, orif crunchy is harder then you like, FYI you can always store them in a jar with a brown sugar bear or piece of white bread for a period and they will soften right up. Anyhow, I will be selling assortments of these tonight chez @hideoutchicago at the Holiday Sale! Starting 6:00 p.m. Peace n love.
air freshener for your car! (look closer)

A cookie garden pavilion made from store-bought tea biscuits for the sides and a gingerbread cookie for the roof, with a Necco wafer / mini-M&M shield and a gum paste / icing flag atop, all on a homemade sugar cookie. The Illustrated Cookies motto, in possibly dodgy and certainly imperfectly double-checked Latin, runs in a frieze around three sides of the building. You can make pretty things with simple ingredients: I used Kedem biscuits (although I have an idea LU biscuits might have been sturdier if I'd found them), which are $.89 a pack, and sandwich bags, with which I often ice cookies, are cheap too. Make pretty things.
Shadows and light describe the edges of monochromatic shapes and swirls in muted matte Wedgewood color.
Needlework is getting tinier ‪
Recent cookie designs, such as this new one, confirming we really do need more places to store/serve our mini M&Ms
Garden of swirly vines and lil flowers

The Wonderful Wizard of Oz! (2 different views.) Cyclone, Dorothy's house, a bit of chapter one in rows like grass, and a few nods to the original edition including some of the palette (pale green & blue) and the hand drawn text in the lower case As and Rs (all hail Frederic Goudy, who reportedly did the lettering for illustrator W.W. Denslow). The cyclone is gum paste with royal icing overtop; Dorothy's house is royal icing.
Set of cookies for a lovely dog trainer. On them: clickers, tennis balls, Kongs, portrait(s) of her (lovely) dog, collars, bones, (heh) poop bags! Happy Friday!
A little pig trotting across your dessert to wish you happy weekend.
Green & white for St. Pat's
Colorful little roundies for a sweet kid.

Chicago: come on out to @hideoutchicago tonight (5:30-8:00) for the last Soup & Bread of the season! Soup & Bread & (Baked Goods Including) Pie! I made these chocolate mint brownies (with three kinds of chocolate chips), layered with mint filling, and topped with a light chocolate buttercream. The toppers are mint royal icing "bowls" with mini M&Ms and tiny cookies with chocolate mint glaze and mint letters (and a white chocolate ampersand!). Soup & Bread is an extremely worthy & win/win/win/win creation: great food from great cooks, warm humans to hug or bump into as you sample soups, $ straight to food relief in the Chicago area, good drinks from the Hideout to whet your appetite.
https://www.facebook.com/events/6783087223669

A funky tower that's kind of a nod to California Arts & Crafts architecture and definitely a testimony to Lucky Charms marshmallows, which turn out to make decent building material. Cupola roof is gumpaste, the other architectural details are all royal icing transfers. Cookie is 3” square, tower about 4-1/2" high. Happy Friday!
Tiny dome of royal icing netting too delicate to last, really, but sweet as it melts on the tongue. Have a lovely weekend —

Something good for me in the rough year that was 2016: I made a lot of cookies, learned a lot about the sugar arts, expressed myself, made some people happy. Thank you very very much for supporting my work in lots of different ways, I feel like I was really lucky to be enjoying myself. Let us take care of each other in the coming year. Peace, love, and cookies. Happy new year!
Some Friday mint chocolate cookie art — lots more coming.
Coooookie.
New lace design, made to look like banding/fabric trim (inset photo for scale)
Monday chocolate needlework
Almost 500 followers on Facebook! An @illustratedcookies cookie poker chip to celebrate (and thank you) —
A purple, red, and green set for Mom*, including needlework, a little epergne, enamelwork, other styles. Have a good weekend!

Thanks again to the @chicago_reader and @mikesula for a lovely piece in the paper about my cookies last week, complete with slide show. Link in profile, or can be laboriously c&p-ed from this: http://www.chicagoreader.com/Bleader/archives/2016/07/28/elizabeth-tamnys-cookies-look-too-good-to-eatbut-dont-let-that-stop-you
A cookie‬ epergne! For all your Victorian serving needs (Skittles, mini chocolate chips). Middle bottom photo is base of cookie without bowl atop. (Cookie is about 2-1/2" wide.) ‪
p.s. It's my birthday today! So grateful and happy to be here. :)
